author: sky.cactus
content: *Today* where can I find a list of EIPs that went into each hard fork?

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm trying to figure out which net gas metering EIP went into Constantinople/Petersberg.

author: poojaranjan
content: <@301186049323958275> https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1283

author: poojaranjan
content: I suppose it was then removed. Ref: https://blog.ethereum.org/2019/02/22/ethereum-constantinople-st-petersburg-upgrade-announcement/

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, the situation was complicated so I was hoping to find a place that included the EIPs in each HF to try to figure out the current state of things.

author: poojaranjan
content: As per my recollection, this list was missing in Meta EIP till Constantinople and people were looking for this. So, it was  proposed to be added in the Meta EIP for Istanbul and onward and is available in EIP-1679: Hardfork Meta: Istanbul.

author: poojaranjan
content: Ethereum.org has added this page about upgrade history https://ethereum.org/en/history/ but it also has this information missing. I proposed it to  <@!485238712415027221> (ethereum.org website) recently to  add the EIPs info. Hopefully, will be added to the history page soon.

author: poojaranjan
content:
Peep an EIP with Vitalik Buterin & Martin Swende (EIP-2929 & EIP-2930)

Time: Jan 15, 2021  at 1330 UTC(About 2.5 hrs.)

author: poojaranjan
content: I've created a place holder in the *Network upgrade retrospective* for this list as well - https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/Network%20Upgrade%20Retrospective/Report%20Template.md but so far we have only one upgrade retrospective available for Muir Glacier only that contained only one EIP  ðŸ™‚ https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/Network%20Upgrade%20Retrospective/Muir%20Glacier%20upgrade%20retrospective.md#eip-included
